00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the list of Operators
00004 #
00005 package Parser::Context::Operators;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Value::Context::Data);
00008 
00009 sub init {
00010   my $self = shift;
00011   $self->{dataName} = 'operators';
00012   $self->{name} = 'operator';
00013   $self->{Name} = 'operator';
00014   $self->{namePattern} = qr/.+/;
00015   $self->{tokenType} = 'op';
00016 }
00017 
00018 #
00019 #  Remove an operator from the list by assigning it
00020 #    the undefined operator.  This means it will still
00021 #    be recognized by the parser, but will generate an
00022 #    error message whenever it is used.
00023 #
00024 sub undefine {
00025   my $self = shift;
00026   my @data = ();
00027   foreach my $x (@_) {
00028     if ($self->{context}{operators}{$x}{type} eq 'unary') {
00029       push(@data,$x => {
00030     class => 'Parser::UOP::undefined',
00031     oldClass => $self->get($x)->{class},
00032       });
00033     } else {
00034       push(@data,$x => {
00035     class => 'Parser::BOP::undefined',
00036     oldClass => $self->get($x)->{class},
00037       });
00038     }
00039   }
00040   $self->set(@data);
00041 }
00042 
00043 sub redefine {
00044   my $self = shift; my $X = shift;
00045   return $self->SUPER::redefine($X,@_) if scalar(@_) > 0;
00046   $X = [$X] unless ref($X) eq 'ARRAY';
00047   my @data = ();
00048   foreach my $x (@{$X}) {
00049     my $oldClass = $self->get($x)->{oldClass};
00050     push(@data,$x => {class => $oldClass, oldClass => undef})
00051       if $oldClass;
00052   }
00053   $self->set(@data);
00054 }
00055 
00056 #########################################################################
00057 
00058 1;
